title: Name Fed to the Reeds
description: A new waterway has appeared in the Mourning Mire—a straight cut like a spear-thrust—and those who take it return without their shadows. The Willowwives whisper that a relic-needle of the drowned queen was stolen from the Order long ago, and the queen’s memory wants it fed with a true name before she bargains safe passage again. Ossa asks Kezra to bring fairness to the Accord and boldness to the rite: return with the relic-needle from a peat-cache, speak a name that means something, and balance the Accord with terms that do not tax the mire into clever lies. The reeds remember the night Kezra asked for a way out and paid something not yet collected.
objectives: Locate the peat-cache where the relic-needle is hidden by following ghost lights that mimic lanterns—without being led astray.
Parley with the drowned queen’s memory at the straight waterway; offer a true name and bind terms for safe passage.
Write and witness a renewed Willowwife Accord that protects both city and mire from predatory terms.
Return the relic-needle to the Order under conditions that respect Willowwife rites.

dialogue.speaker: Ossa Wreath
dialogue.lines: You walked our reeds once and left a breath of your name on them. The queen remembers flavors better than faces. Bring the needle back, and don’t let the Order turn our grief into a sermon. Give her a name that costs you without breaking you; that’s how bargains survive winter.

dialogue.speaker: The Drowned Queen’s Memory
dialogue.lines: I am not a demon, little oath. I am a meal the river keeps eating and serving again. Names are salt, and I am hungry. Speak a true one, not the one you wear in markets. Then I will let the children find the long way home, and pilots who whistle wrong will live long enough to learn the right tune.

dialogue.speaker: Prior Ansel of the Black Thistle
dialogue.lines: We do not traffic with river masks to abate a temporary danger. And yet—your city is built on bridges across worse compromises. Bring back the relic, and if you must make a bargain, bind it so tightly to your own breath that no one else pays for it.

dialogue.speaker: Kezra Thorneglass
dialogue.lines: I have a name I’ve kept for nights when I dream of water. I’ll feed it to you and not flinch. In return, we set terms that don’t drown anyone slowly. Ossa, I’ll write the Accord like it’s a raft we all have to stand on at once.

npcs_involved: Prior Ansel of the Black Thistle

rewards: Safe-passage token woven of bone-white reeds (grants advantages in mire and on certain canals)
Relic-needle recovered and entrusted for the final rite
